comments:
Build ID: I20070525-1350

Steps To Reproduce:
When trying to open an XML Editor for a file with an extension, other than .xml, this error occurs.

The problem still persists after creating a new content type and file association, as proposed in the popup dialog, that apears first.

I've tested it with different extensions. First i wanted to associate *.jnlp files with the XML Editor, then i tested *.myxml to see if it is in any way related to the jnlp extension. But it is not.

Interestingly, after assigning a file association, on the content type page, the *.jnlp extesnion was locked by the 'Report Design' content type

More information:

Andreas, what kind of file were you opening in the editor?  Did that content type extend the XML content type?

At first not, but then i created a new XML content type for the extension *.jnlp
Now i have noticed, that this problem disapears after a restart of Eclipse. So this is not a real big issue anymore, but that error message still is a little bit confusing and the restart, that is necessary is not a good solution. The newly created content types should be recognized immediately.

There appears to be 2 issues:
1) The ClassCastException/editor not working when you load up a non-xml content type in the xml editor.  Even if the content type is incorrect, we should open up the editor for limited usage.  There may be some incorrect assumptions going on in StructuredTextViewer#configure

2) After you assign your file extension to the xml content type and then you try to reopen a file you previously attempted, the editor should now be able to load the file.  But that's not happenning (all other files you didnt attempt to open before with the same extension does work immediately though).  It looks like something may be wrong in TextFileDocumentProvider or the previous document is never disconnected from the document provider.

I want to raise the priority of this bug to P2 and target this for WTP 2.0 RC2 because we're basically leaking documents and anything else associated with an editor.

When a user tries to open a file with an unsupported file extension in the XML editor, the xml multipage editor runs into the ClassCastException mentioned in comment #0 during creation of the source page editor.  Since it hits the exception during creation, the source page editor never gets added to the list of editors nested in the XML multipage editor even though the source page editor has essentially be created (it's mostly configured and its document is connected to the text file document provider).   So, when the XML multipage editor calls dispose() and tries to dispose its nested editors, the almost created source page editor's dispose() is never called.

Adding Nitin for review.

Oh, and in case anyone is curious as to why this problem is showing up now, it's because the default TextSourceViewerConfiguration (which is what is used for unrecognized file/content types) now returns MonoReconciler in getReconciler() for spell checking (it used to just return null)
Approved, looks very safe, and important since users still instinctively associate their filename extensions to the editor directly before going to the content type and adding them there.
Increasing severity based on the anecdotal number of reports we get for similar not-associated errors.
Fix has been committed and released and should be in a WTP 2.0 RC2 build > 200706042300
*** Bug 192900 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
